intro: Pedicularis odontocorys, commonly known as the toothed lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and alpine meadows. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
